provider.name: Ryan
provider.address: 2015 W Broadway St, Unit 3A, Ardmore, OK 73401

context: 16 months post-op with persistent compensation patterns
Primary pattern to retrain: extension default should become low-grade flexion
findings: Compensatory thoracic extension remains primary movement default
Scapular winging appears secondary to weakness and posterior guarding
Left shoulder muscle mass deficit needs targeted strengthening
Thoracic segment mobility constrained by surgical history
prescribed: Dead hangs (unmodified) for lengthening under tension + stability
Reverse lawnmower rotational fascial pattern (mid/high level)
Anterior chain fly with posterior control (dual-component)
Pull-aparts and backward pulling movements (up to 3 min as tolerated)
Hold parameters: 10-30 seconds depending on exercise

plan.next_sessions: Monday + Thursday at 5:00 PM next week
plan.notes: Good tolerance to decompressive hanging; continue progression if pain-free

notes: Source: =notes/atlas/health/pt-sessions-ryan.md Session 3 section. Structured fields normalized for dashboard renderer compatibility.

concerns.title: Pectoral engagement severely limited (~2-3/10)
concerns.detail: Key recovery indicator; muscles guarding/spasming to protect unstable ribs

concerns.title: SICK scapula (left) — winging pattern
concerns.detail: Primary treatment focus this session. Serratus and subscap connection issues affecting shoulder blade positioning.

concerns.title: Upper trap dominance (6:1 vs 2:1 target)
concerns.detail: Upper trap holds tension and is overly dominant. Lower trap (medial border to thoracic spine) weakened.

concerns.title: Pec minor aggravation from compensation
concerns.detail: Jack defaults to shoulder extension when asked for core flexion — creates protraction and winging instead of proper ab engagement

morning: 15g collagen + 500mg Vitamin C + 20oz water before moving
Diaphragmatic reset: 10 min posterior rib breathing (crocodile position, 4-4-4 pattern)
Log roll exit from bed (no trunk rotation)
Peroneal release (R foot) — tennis ball under lateral foot, 2-3 min
Hip extension stretch — standing, 30sec x3 (releases psoas, stops anterior rib flare)
protocol.supplements: Collagen 15g AM, Vitamin C 1000mg/day (500 x2), Magnesium 400mg PM, 80oz+ water
protocol.restrictions: No spinal rotation >45°, no overhead reaching, no heavy lifting

exercises.name: Serratus activation
exercises.detail: Prone position, wrists ahead of elbows. Focus on shoulder blade engagement.

exercises.name: Core/rotation work
exercises.detail: Squeeze ball, contract core, rotate toward foot. Ab compression NOT shoulder extension. Exhale on effort.

exercises.name: Scap strengthening (dead hang)
exercises.detail: Dead hang position, maintain shoulder blade engagement. Progress to alternating leg marches.

exercises.name: Scap-ups
exercises.detail: Continue from home program. Avoid compensation patterns.

exercises.name: Balloon breathing
exercises.detail: Exhale training + rotational stability. Ball compression while blowing balloon and reaching.

exercises.name: Anti-rotation band work
exercises.detail: Modified walk-outs with super band or thera band. Isometric eccentric control — NOT active twisting.

exercises.name: Modified dead hangs
exercises.detail: With scapular and balloon control for shoulder stability.

exercises.name: Transverse abdominis activation
exercises.detail: Supine, knees bent, draw belly button to spine, hold 5s

exercises.name: Modified crocodile breathing
exercises.detail: Prone, towel under R foot, inhale 4ct into posterior ribs, exhale with R foot dorsiflexion

exercises.name: Wall angels
exercises.detail: Back against wall, arms at 90°, slide up/down maintaining contact, stop before compensation

questions: Balloon protocol check-in — Am I doing the exhale + reach + ball compression correctly? Any form corrections?
Reusable breathing trainers — Expand-A-Lung, POWERbreathe ($20-40). Can these substitute for or supplement the balloon protocol?
Diaphragm damage — Counselor and I discussed the extent of breathing impact. What's your assessment of diaphragm function? Is there a specific test?
Home exercise frequency — How many times/day for balloon work? Anti-rotation band work?
Progress markers — What should I look for to know exercises are working? What's realistic for 2-week, 1-month improvement?
Pain during driving/grocery — Positioning causes pain. Any car ergonomic adjustments or pre-activity prep?
Cost comparison — Still weighing $115 here vs $95 self-pay alternative. Your thoughts on continuity of care vs cost savings?
decompressionReset: Do NOT push rib back. Lie on R side → reach L arm overhead → deep breath into L flank → let gravity + breath reset → hold 2-3 min.

careTeam.name: Established
careTeam.note: Last: Feb 6 — need to schedule next

sinceLastSession: Focused on retraining movement away from compensatory extension
Prepared for increased fascial-line and posterior-chain work

provider.name: Ryan
provider.address: 2015 W Broadway St, Unit 3A, Ardmore, OK 73401

context: Month 16 of 24 post-Hansen bilateral rib reconstruction (Oct 11, 2024)
Hansen technique: Ribs 8-10 sutured to rib 7, reconstructing costal margin bilaterally
Dr. Hansen Jan 2025 CT: "Repair sites look good"
Critical collagen remodeling window: months 12-18 (we're IN IT)
Bioabsorbable PLLA/PLGA plates degrading via hydrolysis — biological fusion still forming
Hardware status: Plates degrading ("gravel-like" debris) — expected, but instability gap persists until biological fusion completes
sinceLastSession: Started balloon breathing exercises (PRI 12" latex balloons)
Counseling session (Feb 12) surfaced honest physical assessment: diaphragm damage affecting breathing, driving/shopping difficulty from pain
CPAP usage ongoing — sleep quality improving but still subtherapeutic some nights
PERMA-V Vitality dropped from 7.2 to 6.5 (honest reckoning with physical limitations)
Ordered NordBench Pro for home exercise support

questions: Balloon protocol check-in — Am I doing the exhale + reach + ball compression correctly? Any form corrections?
Reusable breathing trainers — Expand-A-Lung, POWERbreathe ($20-40). Can these substitute for or supplement the balloon protocol?

findings: Shoulder blade winging — primary treatment focus, addressed with acupuncture needling + exercises
Joint quality 'trashy' — grindy, clunky movement patterns abnormal for age
Upper trap dominance: 6:1 ratio vs lower trap (target is 2:1)
Serratus and subscap connection issues affecting shoulder blade positioning
Pec minor aggravated from extension/reaching compensation — Jack defaults to shoulder extension instead of core flexion
Previous labral tear contributed to compensatory shoulder patterns — compromised joint position
Sleep apnea causing rib tightness, affecting treatment area
prescribed: Serratus activation — prone, wrists ahead of elbows, 15 reps or to burn
Core/rotation — squeeze ball, contract core, rotate toward foot. Ab compression NOT shoulder extension. Exhale on effort.
Scap strengthening — dead hang position, maintain shoulder blade engagement. Progress to alternating leg marches.
decompressionReset: Do NOT push rib back. Lie on R side → reach L arm overhead → deep breath into L flank → let gravity + breath reset → hold 2-3 min.

careTeam.name: Established
careTeam.note: Last: Feb 6 — need to schedule next

notes: Treatment: acupuncture needling for blood flow to shoulder blade region. Key correction: Jack compensates with shoulder extension instead of core flexion — must retrain ab engagement.

provider.name: Ryan
provider.address: 2015 W Broadway St, Unit 3A, Ardmore, OK 73401

context: Month 16 of 24 post-Hansen bilateral rib reconstruction (Oct 11, 2024)
Hansen technique: Ribs 8-10 sutured to rib 7, reconstructing costal margin bilaterally
Dr. Hansen Jan 2025 CT: "Repair sites look good"
Critical collagen remodeling window: months 12-18 (we're IN IT)
Bioabsorbable PLLA/PLGA plates degrading via hydrolysis — biological fusion still forming
Hardware status: Plates degrading ("gravel-like" debris) — expected, but instability gap persists until biological fusion completes

concerns.title: Pectoral engagement severely limited (~2-3/10)
concerns.detail: Key recovery indicator; muscles guarding/spasming to protect unstable ribs

concerns.title: SICK scapula (left)
concerns.detail: Scapular malposition, inferior medial border prominence, coracoid pain, dyskinesis; documented labral tear + rotator cuff impingement

concerns.title: Compensatory guarding patterns
concerns.detail: 16 months of protection locking up movement; risk of becoming permanent

concerns.title: Kinetic chain dysfunction
concerns.detail: Right foot Jones fracture (5th met with screw) → Spiral Line fascial pathway → left ribs

morning: 15g collagen + 500mg Vitamin C + 20oz water before moving
Diaphragmatic reset: 10 min posterior rib breathing (crocodile position, 4-4-4 pattern)
Log roll exit from bed (no trunk rotation)
Peroneal release (R foot) — tennis ball under lateral foot, 2-3 min
Hip extension stretch — standing, 30sec x3 (releases psoas, stops anterior rib flare)
protocol.supplements: Collagen 15g AM, Vitamin C 1000mg/day (500 x2), Magnesium 400mg PM, 80oz+ water
protocol.restrictions: No spinal rotation >45°, no overhead reaching, no heavy lifting

exercises.name: Transverse abdominis activation
exercises.detail: Supine, knees bent, draw belly button to spine, hold 5s

exercises.name: Modified crocodile breathing
exercises.detail: Prone, towel under R foot, inhale 4ct into posterior ribs, exhale with R foot dorsiflexion

exercises.name: QL release
exercises.detail: Side-lying, foam roll L hip to ribs, pause at tender spots 30s, add contralateral arm reach

exercises.name: Wall angels
exercises.detail: Back against wall, arms at 90°, slide up/down maintaining contact, stop before compensation

exercises.name: Standing wood chops (light band)
exercises.detail: 3-5 lb, feet wide, R foot forward, chop high-R to low-L, rotation limited to 45°

questions: Pectoral engagement at ~2-3/10 — is this rib guarding, SICK scapula, or both?
Should we prioritize rib stabilization before aggressive shoulder PT, or parallel?
Would IASTM/ART be helpful before standard strengthening? (15+ months of adhesions — pec minor, conjoint tendon, clavipectoral fascia all likely fibrotic)
Spiral Line: right foot → left rib connection — should we address foot biomechanics?
Do you see classic SICK scapula presentation or secondary rib compensation?
Realistic pectoral engagement targets by month 18?
Home exercise program — continue Phase 1 or modify?
findings: Diaphragmatic breathing dysfunction from long-term compensation patterns
Muscles trained into abnormal patterns during recovery period
Three-dimensional bracing compromised — muscles need proper positioning for lung/diaphragm volume expansion
Shoulder blade winging due to lengthened serratus anterior
Rib cage misalignment affecting shoulder control
Fascial connections between shoulder blade, pec, and ribs contributing to dysfunction
Floating ribs (possibly 12th rib) anchoring compensatory patterns
prescribed: Balloon work for exhale training + rotational stability (ball compression while blowing balloon and reaching)
Anti-rotation exercises using resistance bands (modified walk-outs, press movements, isometric eccentric control)
Modified dead hangs with scapular and balloon control for shoulder stability
decompressionReset: Do NOT push rib back. Lie on R side → reach L arm overhead → deep breath into L flank → let gravity + breath reset → hold 2-3 min.

careTeam.name: Established
